text: When should BOOL and bool be used in C++?
When should BOOL and bool be used in C++ and why?
I think using bool is cleaner and more portable because it's a built-in type.
But BOOL is unavoidable when you interactive with legacy code/C code, or doing inter-op from .NET with C code/Windows API.

So my policy is:
Use bool inside C++.
Use BOOL when talk to outer world, e.g., export function in windows DLL.
Is there a definitive explanation of when to use one over the other?
